title: Integrate official TrueVision Digital Agency logo across header/footer branding

requirements.text: Add the official TrueVision Digital Agency logo as static assets and reference them from a central configuration so the same logo is used consistently across the site.

quotes:
This is the official logo of **TrueVision Digital Agency**.

Please add this logo to the website:
- Header (top-left or top-center)
- Footer
- Wherever branding is required

Make sure the logo is clearly visible, properly aligned, and matches the premium dark + neon theme of the website.

acceptanceCriteria: New logo assets exist under frontend/public/assets/generated and are optimized for web use (reasonable file size, crisp edges).
frontend/src/config/site.ts exposes logo asset path(s) and alt text (e.g., full brand name) so components do not hardcode logo filenames.
No page loads the previously hardcoded /assets/generated/truevision-logo-mark.dim_512x512.png unless explicitly kept as a fallback.

requirements.text: Update the site header (Navbar) branding to use the official logo with correct alignment and visibility on the premium dark + neon theme, including responsive behavior for mobile vs desktop.

quotes:
Please add this logo to the website:
- Header (top-left or top-center)

acceptanceCriteria: Navbar renders the official logo in the left brand area (or top-center on narrow layouts if implemented), linking to the Home route.
Logo is clearly visible against the dark header (no low-contrast blending) and remains sharp at typical sizes (e.g., ~32–40px height).
Branding does not break the existing navbar layout across common breakpoints (mobile menu, tablet, desktop).

requirements.text: Update the site footer branding block to use the official logo and ensure it is properly aligned with the brand text and consistent with the premium dark + neon theme.

quotes:
Please add this logo to the website:
- Footer

acceptanceCriteria: Footer brand section renders the official logo with an appropriate size (e.g., ~40–48px height) and aligned with the brand name text.
Logo remains clearly visible on the footer background and does not appear washed out or too dim.
Footer continues to render without layout shift or overflow on small screens.

requirements.text: Replace any other hardcoded/placeholder branding logo usages (where branding is required) to use the same centrally-configured official logo assets for consistency.
acceptanceCriteria: A search for the previous logo path (/assets/generated/truevision-logo-mark.dim_512x512.png) shows no remaining usage outside any explicit fallback logic.
All branding logo placements (including header/footer) reference the centralized values from frontend/src/config/site.ts.
All logo elements use appropriate alt text that includes the full brand name (e.g., "TrueVision Digital Agency").

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
Do not route logo images through the backend; serve them as static assets from frontend/public.
nonGoals: Creating new pages or changing site navigation structure.
Reworking the overall theme beyond what is necessary to keep the logo visible/aligned on the existing dark + neon design.

edits: Remove background to transparent and export a horizontal lockup PNG (IMG_20251121_124542_843.webp > truevision-logo-lockup.dim_600x200.png)
Remove background to transparent and export a square mark/icon PNG (IMG_20251121_124542_843.webp > truevision-logo-mark.dim_256x256.png)
Create a high-contrast variant suitable for very dark backgrounds if needed (IMG_20251121_124542_843.webp > truevision-logo-lockup-dark.dim_600x200.png)
